channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: NASA's Mars helicopter becomes the first aircraft to fly on another planet
item.description: NASA's Ingenuity Mars helicopter has completed its initial flight, marking the first time an aircraft has flown on another planet.

item.title: The UK is considering starting a digital currency
item.description: The Bank of England and HM Treasury are jointly exploring a central bank digital currency that would co-exist alongside traditional cash and deposits.

item.title: Positive Grid Spark Pearl review: A high-tech guitar amp that's easy on the eyes
item.description: The Positive Grid Spark is one of, if not the most high-tech practice amp out there and packs a lot of versatility for $299.

item.title: Fitbit trackers and smartwatches are at all-time low prices
item.description: You can now pickup Fitbit's Sense smartwatch for $249, the cheapest price we've seen yet.

item.title: The Morning After: Amazon cancels its 'Lord of the Rings' MMORPG
item.description: Todayâ€™s headlines: New York caps the cost of broadband for low-income families, Amazon cancels its Lord of the Rings RPG and two die in Tesla crash with no-one at the wheel.

item.title: Manager of prominent Fin7 hacking group sentenced to 10 years in prison
item.description: The manager of a hacking group known as Fin7 has been sentenced to 10 years in prison for his role in an international cybercrime operation that targeted US banks and retailers.

item.title: Amazon's Fire HD 8 and Blink Mini camera bundle is $75 for today only
item.description: Amazon is offering its Kindle Fire HD 8 tablet and Blink Mini security camera bundle for $75 as part of a limited time deal.

item.title: Sony's FlavorGraph uses AI to predict which ingredients will pair together
item.description: AI has gone into games and self-driving with mixed success, but now it's trying its hand at cooking.

item.title: New York caps the cost of broadband for low-income families
item.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo has signed a bill requiring all internet service providers (ISPs) to offer $15 per month broadband for low-income users.

item.title: Audi unveils its A6 e-tron concept ahead of Auto Shanghai 2021
item.description: At the biannual Auto Shanghai 2021 expo this week, Audi provided a sparkly peek at its future EV plans with the official debut of its new A6 e-tron concept vehicle.

item.title: US investigates code testing hack that could affect thousands of companies
item.description: The US is investigating a hack at Codecov that could affect thousands of companies, including Proctor & Gamble and GoDaddy.

item.title: Two die in Tesla crash with no one at the wheel
item.description: Two men have died in a Tesla crash where no one appeared to be in the driver's seat.

item.title: Amazon cancels 'Lord of the Rings' game after contract dispute
item.description: Amazon has cancelled its 'Lord of the Rings' game after a contract dispute reportedly soured the project.

item.title: Adobe co-founder Charles Geschke dies at 81
item.description: Adobe co-founder Charles Geschke has died at 81, leaving behind a major legacy in creative software through PDFs and PostScript.

item.title: Apple's 512GB Mac Mini M1 returns to a record-low $800 at Amazon
item.description: Apple's M1 Mac Mini with 512GB storage has returned to a record-low $800 price at Amazon.

item.title: Automate your cleaning with this affordable robot vacuum
item.description: The Kyvol Cybovac S31 is a 2-in-1 robot vacuum that learns your floor plan, cleans only where you want it and it can even mop. This robovac takes care of your home and itself by cleaning on schedule and charging itself when it needs to.

item.title: Nintendo sues Bowser for violating copyright with Switch hacks
item.description: Nintendo is suing Bowser (that is, Gary Bowser) for allegedly violating copyright by selling Switch hacks.

item.title: 'Roblox' will use content ratings to help limit access to sexual material
item.description: 'Roblox' creators have promised a content rating system that will help prevent kids from seeing sexual activity in games on the platform.

item.title: NASA will attempt to fly its Mars helicopter on April 19th
item.description: NASA now expects to fly its Mars helicopter Ingenuity no earlier than April 19th, with live coverage that morning.

item.title: Chrome 90 will let you share links to highlighted text
item.description: Google has started rolling out a feature for Chrome 90, which will allow you to create a link that takes people straight to the part of a page you highlighted.

item.title: Washington state votes to ban new gas car sales by 2030
item.description: Washington state has voted for a measure that will ban sales of gas-powered cars by 2030, years before California.

item.title: Peloton opposes US demand for Tread+ recall following child injuries
item.description: Peloton is fighting US demands for a Tread+ recall after reports of numerous injuries to children, including one death.

item.title: Hitting the Books: How Planck's 'chain of tiny beads' helps explain why lightbulbs work
item.description: 'Einstein's Fridge' author Paul Sen explores the works and quirks of the pioneering researchers â€” from Lord Kelvin and James Joule to Emmy Noether, Alan Turing, and Stephen Hawking â€” who sought to understand how heat helped shape the known universe.

item.title: Studio SWEAT delivers a gym experience to your home for $99
item.description: With a one-year subscription to Studio SWEAT onDemand, you get access to a massive list of live and pre-recorded fitness classes. Youâ€™ll join thousands of other members who are working out remotely while still enjoying the full gym experience.

item.title: iRobot's Roomba i7+ with clean base is $200 off at Wellbots
item.description: Save big on iRobot's Roomba i7+ and i9+ robot vacuums at Wellbots.
